name: Las Casas de la Juderia

reviews.text: Very nice hotel in the very downtown of the Old city. Rooms are spacious and comforteable, and staff is very nice and helpful. The hotel is an old building very well preserved, although sometimes a little laberynth, at least the first day. Do not miss the Santa Maria La Blanca church, a gem that is just side by side.
reviews.title: convenient, comforteable, nice

reviews.text: We booked four nights at this hotel and loved it all. Perfect start to our holiday in Spain. Seville was such a special place to visit and totally amazed me. The weather during December, the food, the people and the attractions were amazing.
reviews.title: So Glad we stayed. Excellent start to our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is well situated close to everything. About a ten minute walk to the cathedral and main attractions of Seville. There are lots of good places to eat right outside the door. The foyer and inner courtyards are beautiful. There is no WIFI in the bedrooms but honestly this does not matter. The kids sat in the main foyer which is large and beautiful and simply a nice place to sit and relax.
reviews.title: Georgeous place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole hotel has lots of character and charm and really beautiful. The rooms are great and the bathrooms look like they have been modernised recently. We booked two rooms one with a double bed and one for the kids right across from us( 11 and 13 year olds) .
reviews.title: Beautiful and one of a kind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a beautiful bar upstairs which had a gentleman playing the piano in the evenings so that we could enjoy a drink before wandering out for a late dinner. Downstairs through this interesting collection of tunnels is a spa and a breakfast setup. Breakfast was good with a selection of fruit, cereals and some eggs and bacon. You could also order some crepes and a few other things off a menu.
reviews.title: Gorgeous historical place to stay

aka: Las Casas De La Juderia Hotel
description: Ensconced among the winding labyrinth of narrow roads found at the heart of Seville’s old quarter, modern style and classic tradition converge in the hotel Las Casas de la Judería. History fills the air in this magnificent Old World style establishment with a superb architectural style which harmoniously reflects the authentic feel of the serpentine neighbourhood that surrounds it. The vibrant colours that dress the hotel’s interiors and the friendly service provided by the affable staff fantastically mirror the true character of Andalusia. • Formed by an ensemble of traditional Andalusian-style houses, Las Casas de la Judería is characterised by its charming central courtyards dominated by a set of gorgeous fountains. The hotel presents an array of services for your enjoyment, such as live music in the animated piano bar, and a full sized outdoor pool, the perfect place to lie back in and enjoy the sunny climate of southern Spain. Breakfast in the hotel’s “Mirror Hall” helps get the day off to a pleasant start, while a dinner IN EMPORION RESTAURANT elaborated with the finest Mediterranean ingredients is the perfect ending. Add all this to the excellent meeting rooms the hotel offers, and you have the makings for a hotel that is ideal for not only for vacationers, but for business travellers as well. • Located in the heart of Seville, the hotel Las Casas de la Judería offers superbly convenient access to some of the most symbolic attractions in Spain. You will find a vast gamma of the city’s most important monuments within one kilometre of the hotel, such as The Giralda bell tower of the Cathedral, or the Royal Alcázar of Seville, an impressive Moorish-style palace.
